text: No.  But now have found a small glass of wine.
author: LisaDNews

text:
What covering the Mueller investigation is like, literally *and* figuratively.

(Max and I roamed the halls of the Capitol office bldgs today.)
author: LisaDNews

text:
SEN. COONS: said he's worried that the committee may learn about what's coming from the AG over social media from the Judiciary Chairman (Graham).

Said he hopes it doesn't go that way, but it could.
author: LisaDNews

text:
SEN COONS on reporter call now: We understand there are three things the AG may need to redact/withhold from the Mueller report.  
1. Ongoing investigations that overlap
2. Grand jury information/testimony
3. Classified material
author: LisaDNews

text:
Confirmed: House Dems to hold 3p conf. call re: Mueller.  From multiple sources, likely to be about messaging.  

Caucus Chair Jeffries to lead, with relevant committee chairs.

author: LisaDNews

- None of them charged w/ conspiring w/ Russia.
- Bulk of indictments: Two dozen Russian nationals.

(Passed House 420-0).

Sen. Graham blocked that vote over concerns he has about the Clinton investigation.

text: To clarify - U.S. borrowed *an additional* $8.4 billion a day.
author: LisaDNews

text:
1. Means the U.S. gov. borrowed $8.4 billion A DAY in Feb. 

2. Each day, that's 6x what the Marine Corps is pleading for to stay solvent.

3. 10 days of that = enough to pay all public college tuition for a year.

4. This record deficit came in shortest month of yr.
author: LisaDNews

text: Oh I think we are fine. Wasn't saying anything about being rude. Just wanted to sort out b/c I couldn't remember deleting or writing anything like that - and misunderstood it for me.

text: Absolutely.
author: LisaDNews

text:
Thank you to you all and @neithskye.  (Apologies to those I left out - hard to keep track.)  There are no words I can say to improve what happened to you but I am sincerely sorry. 

I'm still digesting but look at adoption very differently than I did two days ago.
author: LisaDNews

text: I don't know if this does it either but added, "we want to make sure that any birth mother, father or family considering adoption also knows that if they want to raise their child, but simply doesn't have the resources, there are places to help." (Link is there.)
author: LisaDNews

text: Adding that to our website, along with new language in several places.  I worry I may still miss the mark, but one example: "It's very important that any child has the chance for open contact and relationships with their birth family; to know their full family on their terms."
author: LisaDNews

text: thank you!
author: LisaDNews

text: That's an example of a tweet I'd delete!  I meant to say it was *NOT* a story I had been planning.  I'll leave it up though as I understand concerns about deletions in this conversation, hopefully people will see this correction.
author: LisaDNews

text: I don't recall deleting a tweet - that's rare for me, though sometimes I do it b/c of typos or misspellings.  I just requested my archive from Twitter to check.  I am sorry if I said anything about you being "unwanted", I am not sure what that tweet said or what that is.
author: LisaDNews

text: I had been planning a story but am now considering trying to pitch one. This is clearly an area where so many of us have been shockingly unaware of how key voices (yours) feel and how different adoption looks to many of those most affected.
author: LisaDNews

text:
More to say from your many powerful statements.  (Thank you.)

But first a favor. Could one or all of you send suggestions for places online where pregnant women/bfs worried about resources to care for their baby can go for help to keep/raise their child?
author: LisaDNews

text: Maybe one-sided but I'm bonding so much with you and your newsroom right now over this photo.
author: LisaDNews

*Deletes "Kavanaugh" folder in e-mail 
*Deletes "2018" folder

*Creates "2020" folder
author: LisaDNews

text: Thank *you*. I feel a bit like I've been punched in the gut taking this in.  And I feel that's a good thing.
author: LisaDNews

text: Thank you.  See my tweets in past few minutes.
author: LisaDNews

text:
The online conversation here is expanding my knowledge and understanding of how crazy one-sided (and often harmful) the adoption conversation has been for, well, forever.  

Sincere thanks for that.
author: LisaDNews

text:
Thank you for this sincerely.  
I am not meaning this defensively,  just to clarify (Twitter is tough), I don't think a child is waiting for us or is lost w/ out us.  It's more a statement of our faith in general and our intention here. I take your points deeply to heart.  (More)
author: LisaDNews

text: I'm sorry about that mix up! Makes sense.
author: LisaDNews

text: Or do you think it is worth pushing back at any adoptive parent? (Not saying that in a judgmental way ... want to understand if this is remotely productive or just me being a punching bag here, when I mean to be much more constructive than that.)
author: LisaDNews

text: Children are not irrevocably separated from their biological families in the way you were.  I'm really sorry, I'm trying to be productive and am so sorry. What happened to you sounds terrible.  Do you think there is any chance you could see that I am trying to be on your side?
author: LisaDNews

text: Listen, I hear you. I am not sure why you keep trying to make it as though we are on opposite sides of this?   I never said that families don't get amended birth certificates - you have a very good point there. What I said was about your full statement -
author: LisaDNews

text: Yeah that's a problem. It is clearly trauma.  We are definitely aware on that count and I think more families on all sides of adoption now know and talk about that.
author: LisaDNews

text: To Read!! Layla did exceptional, fascinating work here:
author: LisaDNews

text:
Good points, and I absolutely understand what you are saying. 
 
Understand this formula is not the case and often not the norm with children born into adoption today.
author: LisaDNews

text:
Listen I wish you well. Please review your tweets and determine who was attacking whom as immoral. 

Again, I'm just asking to converse. Glad you are interested, if you are.  If you are not and I keep taking the bait, I regret it. Either way, I wish you well. --30--
author: LisaDNews

text:
Man, we keep missing each other here. I think we were starting to converse, maybe?  Maybe we step away here and you should feel good that you have raised a good discussion. And I am thinking about it. 

I don't feel I was lecturing.  And still hope you are not a robot.
author: LisaDNews

text: And that you have so little experience with the tough situations many kids are in, where adoption can be a lifeline (for everyone).
author: LisaDNews

text:
One last thing. I didn't respond initially b/c honestly your tweets read a bit like a troll or bot.  

I'm open to real conversations here but I think your level of judgment closes that.  And more and more makes me wonder if you are a robot.  

If not, I'm sorry you are so angry
author: LisaDNews

text:
I am VERY interested in a more in-depth conversation about all of this. I want to understand as much as possible.

But I would hope that you  allow for the idea that there are millions of families with millions of situations.
author: LisaDNews

text: 2. I don't want to put my son's life out for debate, especially not by a stranger and definitely not on twitter where both thought and characters are limited.  It is his story to tell.  And not to be used for anyone (including me) to feel better about ourselves or win a fght
author: LisaDNews

text:
Here's the things. A few things. 
1. I want to have a conversation. I don't want to force you to justify yourself to me. At the same time I don't think I should feel I need to justify myself to you.  That's not a conversation.
author: LisaDNews

text:
I think we have a long way to go to fix the adoption system on many levels. And I don't think adoptive parents are saints. 

But neither do I think making them out as bad guys/wrongdoers or assuming their rationale is fair or helpful.
author: LisaDNews

text: I can only speak to my situation. And I am not countering anything you've said but I don't fit the scenarios you lay out.  Nor does my son. Nor his birth parents, who are part of my life and his life.  But I also think this is a critical conversation and we need to have it more.
author: LisaDNews

text: It is a very good question. There are a few answers. 1. The adoption system in this country is deeply flawed. There is no national way to search.  2. You *can* go through a single agency, but then you are limited to only those they find, it's not a pure matching sysem.

text:
HOUSE VETO OVERRIDE? Is a long shot. Because:

- It requires 2/3 majority
- That's 289 votes currently. (2 vacancies.)
- Dems have 235 votes.
- So they need 54 Republicans.
- But far fewer, just 13 Repubs, voted the first time around to oppose the president.
author: LisaDNews

author: LisaDNews

text:
How does WH justify $174 billion in "emergency/overseas contingency" request?

Senior admin. official was pretty direct (if not using direct words) saying that it is how the admin is getting around the budget cut caps. They blamed Congress.

But of course, POTUS signs bills too.

text: Great question. Answer in next tweet!

author: LisaDNews

text:
NEW. TRUMP BUDGET. POTUS proposes:

- Defense: Increase $34 billion (incl. OCO)
- Non-defense: Cut. Looks like $56 billion. 

On reporter call, WH said it's proposed 5% non-defense cut. But in budget docs, pg 133 below, looks like over 10%.  I'm asking. 

https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/budget-fy2020.pdf …
author: LisaDNews

text:
Props to reporters on the budget call just now for good questions that clarified things.

Embargo on the call is about to lift - meaning we can report what the WH told us.

(At 11:30 a ET.)
author: LisaDNews

text: No, the president is not proposing using any of this for wall money.
author: LisaDNews

text:
OCO 101:
- "Overseas Contingency Operations"
- Was for fighting terror post 9/11.
- It has become a budget gimmick/slush fund/big cushion for Defense.
- Was $19 billion 2002, up to $112 billion in 2004 as Iraq War flared.
- NOW: POTUS asking for **$174 billion**
author: LisaDNews

text:
BUDGET 101 for use today!

- By law, POTUS must submit a budget
- By tradition, Congress usually ignores it.
- This year's $ fight is tricky.
- W/out action, budget cuts are slated to hit in Oct.: 9% cut non-def, 11% defense.
- Don't get me started on OCO. 
(I will though, next)
author: LisaDNews

text:
For the ridiculous file: current back and forth on House floor over which party has a more open/closed process for bills. Meaning, allowing amendments.

*whispers with conviction* Truth?Neither party has had a remotely open process on a regular basis.
author: LisaDNews

text:
For anyone wondering if PBS @NewsHour is as supportive and delightful a place to work as it seems, I refer you to this tweet by the woman who sets the tone here.

I mean, really, we are so lucky and such a good caring team I almost want to punch us in the face.
author: LisaDNews

text: A rare retweet of myself. (From 45 minutes ago.)
author: LisaDNews

text: NOW: House voting on the anti-bigotry resolution.
author: LisaDNews

text: Meantime, this!
author: LisaDNews

text: This very political debate over how to stop America's issues with hate is a perfect show of why those issues are still getting worse.
author: LisaDNews

text: And now. @SpeakerPelosi is on the floor to address all this.
author: LisaDNews

text:
WHAT WE HAVE HERE is a very serious battle of subtext:

- Some Republicans feel, but aren't saying, that white people face hate b/c of their race. 

- Many Jewish members feel adding other hate concerns to the resolution is yet another way to dilute, semi-shrug off the problem.
author: LisaDNews

text:
THIS from Dem. Rep Engel: I do have concerns about how we are handling these issues. 

But I am voting yes because I agree with everything this resolution says.
author: LisaDNews

text: GOP Rep. Doug Collins: Why didn't we add Jehovah's Witnesses? Why didn't we add Mormons?
author: LisaDNews

text:
GOP REP. GOHMERT: We came here to condemn anti-Semitism. And now this resolution condemns everything. 

The reason that is so dangerous is b/c anti-Semitism is a very special kind of hatred.  (Particularly bad, he went on to say.)
author: LisaDNews

text:
PROPS to @cspan for crafting a one-line summary of the complicated Dem resolution/debate in the House.

"Anti-Semitism and Anti-Muslim & Other Hatred."
author: LisaDNews

text:
PELOSI: I don't believe @IlhanMN's remarks were something she meant as anti-semitic.

I spoke to her before doing anything else. We are working on one resolution not mentioning her name - b/c it's not about her, it's about (the issue).
author: LisaDNews

text: Am told Clyburn espcially argued for this anti-hate vote, out of concern GOP would use the Omar comments and debate on a motion to recommit.
author: LisaDNews

text:
HOUSE *WILL* vote today on an anti-hate resolution, meant to address concerns over both Rep. @IlhanMN's comments on Israel and Jewish Americans and backlash/threats toward her and other Muslims. 

This per good sources.

TIming TBD.
Wording TBD.

More...
author: LisaDNews

text:
Chair Thompson: Are we still using cages for children?

Sec. Nielsen: At detention facilities, those weren't made for children.

Thompson: are we still putting children in cages?

Nielsen: CBP never intended that.

Thompson: but are we today doing that?

Nielsen: (no direct ansr)
author: LisaDNews

text:
Rep. Slotkin to Nielsen: When you saw those pictures of babies in cages, what did you do...?

Nielsen: I went to the border to see the facilities myself, then I spent time reviewing how to stabilize the areas from which families were traveling.
author: LisaDNews

text: Nielsen: AG Sessions and I did have a conversation about the Zero Tolerance policy before he announced it, I did not know he was going to announce it that day.
author: LisaDNews

text:
Congratulations Craig! Would love your thoughts on good walk-up music.

cc: @CWSoftballGame, @TexasTribAbby , @DWStweets, @RepMarthaRoby
author: LisaDNews

text: Huh.
author: LisaDNews

text: thank you!!
author: LisaDNews

text:
C'mon everybody!! We are basically YOU away from 1 MILLION followers. 

All in!!
author: LisaDNews

text: Well done!  Exactly. It's a fund set up in theory for emergency/crisis expenses overseas but in actuality is mostly a big giant slush fund.
author: LisaDNews

text:
YES!!

Restraining myself from delving into similar Republicans' emphatic words in the past on paying for spending/tax cuts.
author: LisaDNews

text: Oh believe me. I'm with you. This is why it drives me crazy.  That it even exists at this point.
author: LisaDNews

text: Prepping for the president's budget and the ugly $ fight ahead and feel the need to say: OCO drives me crazy.
author: LisaDNews

text: There is! The one we used was from January 2019. I meant to cite that and failed/forgot.
author: LisaDNews

text:
NOW: Heading to set to talk w/ @JudyWoodruff for our segment looking at the House gun votes this week and state of the gun debate today.

@NewsHour
author: LisaDNews

text:
Felix Sater is perhaps the most colorful character in the wild kaleidoscope that is Trump Inc./Trump-Russia.

"Tied to the mafia/organized crime" is just the first of many, many layers. 

Which also include US spy/key intelligence asset in the hunt for bin Laden.
author: LisaDNews

text: Would have a folo-up about the part about him putting on his shirt.
author: LisaDNews

text:
True.
+ Rhona Graff.

https://www.newsweek.com/rhona-graff-trump-organization-assistant-house-intelligence-committee-russia-756676 …
author: LisaDNews

text: Completely my honor! Thank you for coming to visit!!
author: LisaDNews

text: Words can’t help, I know, but let me say how sincerely sorry I am for your loss.
author: LisaDNews

text:
THIS! MEADOWS: went up to Rep. @RashidaTlaib just now in the chamber (@pkcapitol witnessed), they hugged and talked. 

Meadows told us afterwards that they said they want to have a good relationship and that there wasn’t a need to apologize, that she clarified things yesterday.
author: LisaDNews

text:
This was actually significant for Democrats.  

This motion was GOP attempt to derail Democrats with a tough vote on behalf of domestic violence victims.
author: LisaDNews

text:
NOW: Rep. Debbie Dingell giving a worth-watching, emotional speech about her father's mental illness, how she hid in a closet as a child and ultimately had to keep her father from killing her mother.

"He shouldn't have had a gun!", she said.
author: LisaDNews

text:
Except those Dems running for president are mostly saying (Bernie excepted):

I'm for Medicare for all AND
Medicare at 50 AND
the public option AND
I'm not saying which one I would actually push if president.

I'm for everything.
author: LisaDNews

text:
PELOSI to my q about the gun measures passing the House and whether either can advance in Senate: Public sentiment is everything.  These are bills that have the most bipartisan support and would save the most lives.  

(Implying public pressure on the Sen cld help the bills.)
author: LisaDNews

text: PELOSI: (paraphrase) Kim Jong Un was a big winner in that he was able to sit down with the president of the United States face to face, but it's good the president did not give Kim anything more.
author: LisaDNews

text: 2 min until Pelosi
author: LisaDNews

text: Smh at "debt curve".
author: LisaDNews

text: Looks like some Tom Cruise/Mission Impossible 14 possibilities in that space tho.
author: LisaDNews

text: Susan’s got it right.  We have a sig. issue in both genders on the Hill with far too few reporters of color.  Improving but wayyy too slowly.
author: LisaDNews

text:
This is literally the *last* minute of questions at this hearing. 

And literally the longest minute of this hearing.
author: LisaDNews

text:
COHEN - Just three members left to ask questions after this.  All Dems. All frosh. All ok with making headlines. 

@AyannaPressley, @RashidaTlaib and@AOC.
author: LisaDNews

text:
About that form.

Cohen says his attny believe the  committee form is clear in asking for any work for foreign *governments*, which he has not done.  

He says he would happily disclose his work for foreign *companies*.
author: LisaDNews

text:
COHEN HEARING: back in session. 

Watch here:
author: LisaDNews

text:
Democrats voting 'no' on universal gun background checks today:
Golden (ME)
Peterson (MN)
author: LisaDNews

text:
UNIVERSAL GUN BACKGROUND CHECKS - GOP yes votes today:
Buchanan (FL)
Diaz-Balart (FL)
Fitzpatrick (PA)
Hurd (TX)
King (NY)
Mast (FL)
Smith (NJ)
Upton (MI)
author: LisaDNews

text: I knew that one-hour estimate was a bit fantastic.  (To myself, "is he looking at the same vote series I'm looking at?")
author: LisaDNews

text:
NOW: House just passed bill expanding background checks so they would apply to all gun buyers (unless from a family member).

Now goes to the Senate. Though it does not seem to have the votes there at the moment.
author: LisaDNews

text: Yep just one round. (Though everything always subject to change these days.)
author: LisaDNews

text: COHEN hearing.  So far 14 members of the committee have asked their questions. 28 left to go.
author: LisaDNews

text: (If not obvious, WiFi and cell bandwidth in this room is terrrrrrible.)
author: LisaDNews

text:
GOP’s Mark Green summary: you have lied to Congress and now you are the star witness before Congress?!

Any book deal? Cohen: no, not at this point. 

Jordan: who paid your expenses today? Cohen: I did.
author: LisaDNews

text:
Wasserman-Schultz questioning contained a great deal of significant moments.
- Roger Stone directed by Trump to talk to Wikileaks, or a free agent offering what he had? Cohen: a free agent.
- Could he have the potential to collide w Russians to win at all costs? Cohen: yes.
author: LisaDNews

text:
NOW: Dems going out of order of seniority slightly to have Rep. Debbie Wasserman-Schultz, who headed the DNC when it was hacked, go next.

Worth watching.
author: LisaDNews

text:
NOTE: Very clear from my seat that both sides and Cohen have designed testimony, questions to be TV-soundbite friendly. 

They know the most important judgment here will come from the public.  And it is up for grabs.
author: LisaDNews

text:
CUMMINGS: so the president wrote you a check, while president, to reimburse you for hush money you paid on his behalf?

Cohen: yes.
author: LisaDNews

text: Reminder: Rep. @Jim_Jordan was a national champion wrestler in college.
author: LisaDNews

text: GOP’s JORDAN: This might be the fastest someone who lied to Congress has come back to talk to Congress.
author: LisaDNews

text:
Here we go. 

Republicans (Mark Meadows - maim defensive back here) beginning a likely choppy day by saying Cohen’s testimony arrived intentionally late and the hearing should be postponed.  

Dems will vote this down.

But it is a sign of what this day could be like.
author: LisaDNews

text: MICHAEL COHEN is here.
author: LisaDNews

text: DEM side was all prep and photographers getting ready for Cohen’s entrance.
author: LisaDNews

text: ON THE GOP side of the Cohen hearing: some big visual aids.  And Rep. Jim Jordan planning w his members.
author: LisaDNews

text: Winner
author: LisaDNews

text:
FIRST IN LINE at Cohen hearing is Chip Burgess of Lancaster, PA, self-described political junkie. 

Not his first big-hearing rodeo.
author: LisaDNews

text: COHEN HEARING: I count 169 people in the line for the public.  Those at the front arrived 5:30a or earlier.
author: LisaDNews

text:
Just now. 

Cap Police officer friend to me: whatever you do today, avoid House Oversight.  

Me. *dry laugh* that’s where I’ll be all day

Officer: whoa. Well. Good luck. It’s crazy up there
author: LisaDNews

text: This is funny, bit embarrassing and true.
author: LisaDNews

text: NOW: House voting on whether to end the president’s emergency declaration.
author: LisaDNews

text: NEW: Oversight Chairman Cummings told me he hasn’t seen Cohens opening statement and was not aware of either what might be in it or the WSJ/Axios reports.
author: LisaDNews

text: RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) -- GOP candidate in disputed North Carolina congressional race says he won't run in newly called election.
author: LisaDNews
